SEARCH
Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll

Class CourseRollTest

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll.CourseRollTest
public class CourseRollTest extends Object
Unit tests for the CourseRoll class. This class contains test cases to validate the functionality of the CourseRoll class, including enrollment, waitlist management, and various methods for manipulating the course roll. The tests cover valid and invalid cases for enrolling students, dropping students, and checking waitlist behavior.
Author:
Suyash Patel

  • Constructor Details

    • CourseRollTest

      public CourseRollTest()

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach public void setUp()
      Sets up the test fixture before each test method. This method is called before each test to set up the environment with necessary instances of Course and Student to be used in the tests.

    • testConstructor

      @Test public void testConstructor()
      Tests the constructor of the CourseRoll class for valid and invalid cases. This test ensures that the constructor works correctly for valid cases and throws the appropriate exceptions for invalid cases, such as when the course is null or the enrollment capacity is outside the valid range.

    • testEnrollFullCapacityAndWaitlist

      @Test public void testEnrollFullCapacityAndWaitlist()
      Tests the enroll method with full capacity and waitlist. This test ensures that once the course is full, additional students are added to the waitlist. It checks that the waitlist does not exceed the maximum allowed number of students.

    • testDropFromWaitlist

      @Test public void testDropFromWaitlist()
      Tests dropping students from the waitlist. This test ensures that when a student is dropped from the course, they can be re-enrolled.

    • testDropStudentFromWaitlist

      @Test public void testDropStudentFromWaitlist()
      Tests dropping a student from the waitlist and verifies the update in the waitlist count. This test simulates enrolling a series of students in a course and adding them to the waitlist once the course reaches its enrollment capacity. It then verifies that the number of students on the waitlist is correct after dropping a student from the waitlist.

    • testCanEnrollWithFullWaitlist

      @Test public void testCanEnrollWithFullWaitlist()
      Tests the canEnroll method with a full waitlist. This test ensures that when the course and waitlist are full, additional students cannot enroll.

    • testEnroll

      @Test public void testEnroll()
      Tests the enroll method and verifies waitlist functionality. This test ensures that when a student is enrolled in the course beyond the capacity, they are placed on the waitlist. It also verifies that dropping a student
